scenes.background: You asked Bob to help Monica with some of the updates while you focus on the main task. Later, during a break in the cafeteria, [Monica] approaches you with a somewhat frustrated look. [Bob] is also there, looking concerned.
scenes.description: 'Hey, I thought you were going to handle the task yourself. Why did you ask Bob to help me instead?'

options.text: I thought spreading the workload would get the job done faster.
options.analysis: You justified your decision by focusing on efficiency, showing good emotional perception and a balanced approach to the situation.

options.text: I didn't want to overwhelm myself and thought Bob could assist you better.
options.analysis: You expressed concern for not overwhelming yourself, showing good empathy and motivation. However, social skills could be improved as Monica might feel undervalued.

options.text: Honestly, I didn't think you'd mind. Was I wrong?
options.analysis: You took a more casual approach, asking for feedback, which shows good social skills and self-regulation. However, empathy and motivation could be higher.
